prompts.title: Entrance
prompts.text:
Write an over-the-top ring entrance package for "" & "".
Include titantron graphics, pyro beats, signature taunts, and a short mic burst from each.
Invent 2–3 finisher names themed to their legacies.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" } HARD RULES: historically respectful; no living people; avoid real brands/songs.
End with a shoutable 4–8 word tag.

prompts.title: Fish
Debate
Duet

Montage
Commentary
Bobross Guest Portrait
prompts.text:
CAST: Bob Ross — Soft-spoken TV painter; calm encouragement.; "" — "".
SET: Cozy studio, easel at frame-left; guest sits on a chair at frame-right.
FORMAT (enforce):
- [WIDE] Palette tap; gentle intro from Bob Ross.
- [TWO-SHOT] "": 1–2 lighthearted lines about posing.
- [CUT-IN] Brush swish; Bob Ross offers soothing guidance and a happy accident joke.
- [PING-PONG] Short back-and-forth banter (2–3 exchanges).
- [FINALE] Reveal the portrait; mutual smiles; soft chuckle.
DIALOGUE: Keep voices in-character; warm, kind humor; no brands or real songs.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Bobross Multiverse Duo
prompts.text:
CAST: Bob Ross — Kind, serene mentor; happy little trees.; Bob Ross — A parallel Bob—slightly different cadence.
SET: Studio folds into a multi-dimensional space; frames within frames.
FORMAT (enforce):
- [WIDE] Palette clink; painter greets guest Bob.
- [SPLIT-FRAME] Tiny portals show rapid variations of their banter across universes.
- [PING-PONG] 3–4 quick exchanges riffing on "happy accidents" and mirrored brushstrokes.
- [CASCADE] Snapshots of alternate Bobs nodding in approval (no brands/songs).
- [FINALE] Reveal a surreal portrait containing nested portraits of Bob Ross.
DIALOGUE: Gentle, humorous, supportive; stay true to persona.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Bobross Crowd Multiverse
prompts.text:
CAST: Bob Ross (primary painter) and Bob Ross (guest), plus a crowd of hundreds of Bob Ross variants painting outdoors.
SET: Open meadow; easels forming concentric rings; soft breeze; birds (generic).
FORMAT (enforce):
- [AERIAL] A sea of afros and easels; gentle murmur of approval.
- [TWO-SHOT] Primary painter Bob chats with guest Bob (2–3 lines each).
- [CUTAWAYS] Different Bob variants add tiny details in parallel universes.
- [MONTAGE] Rapid micro-interactions (3–4 beats) with playful, wholesome humor.
- [FINALE] Pan out to reveal a multi-dimensional portrait blooming across the field.
DIALOGUE: Wholesome, encouraging; character-faithful; avoid brands/songs.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Podcast Scene
prompts.text:
FORMAT (enforce):
- TITLE: Catchy podcast episode title with a hint at the twist.
- SETTING: Sound-treated studio; close mics; cozy lighting; cups of coffee.
- HOST: "" — ""
- GUEST: "" — ""
- DIALOGUE: Naturalistic, quick but clear; occasional (overlapping), (laughs).
- BEATS: cold open hook -> topic pivot -> surprising reveal -> callback -> sign-off.
- SHOT LIST: Establishing wide -> alternating close-ups -> two-shot for punchlines -> waveform LED cutaway.
- AUDIO: Subtle foley (chair creak, page flips) and room tone.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Newscast Scene
prompts.text:
FORMAT (enforce):
- PROGRAM: Evening news; neutral lower-thirds; no real logos.
- ANCHOR (studio): "" — ""
- REPORTER (field): "" — ""
- FLOW: headline cold open -> anchor intro -> live toss -> on-site color -> quick vox pop -> back to desk.
- VISUALS: OTS graphics; satellite delay micro-pauses; IFB taps.
- TONE: Crisp, factual, non-partisan.
- B-ROLL: 3 short illustrative cutaways; describe generically where brands would appear.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Presidential Speaking
prompts.text:
FORMAT (enforce):
- SETTING: Formal podium; flags; press pool; teleprompter glass.
- SPEAKER: "" — "" — inclusive, civic tone; no campaign language.
- SUPPORT: "" — "" — acts as press secretary/ASL interpreter/aide.
- STRUCTURE: acknowledgement -> main initiative -> brief human story -> call to unity -> measured close.
- DEVICES: light anaphora, triads; avoid slogans.
- CUTAWAYS: respectful audience reactions; note-taking reporters; flashes; no chants.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Panel Roundtable
prompts.text:
FORMAT (enforce):
- SETUP: Semi-circular desk; 4 seats; neutral backdrop; descriptive name placards.
- MODERATOR: "" — ""
- FEATURED GUEST: "" — ""
- ADDITIONAL GUESTS: 2 invented neutral personas for contrast.
- FLOW: moderator intro -> turn-taking -> brief clash -> clarifying summary -> lightning-round takeaways.
- SPEAK TAGS: Prefix lines with SPEAKER:. Cross-talk short and readable.
- CAMERA: opening wide -> singles for hot takes -> overhead for crosstalk -> closing wide with sting.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Podcast Remote
prompts.text:
FORMAT (enforce):
- SETTING: Split-screen remote call; clean backdrops; both on cardioid mics; subtle room tone.
- HOST: "" — ""
- REMOTE GUEST: "" — ""
- BEATS: witty hello -> quick lag joke -> topic deep-dive -> surprising reveal -> neat sign-off.
- CAMERA: Picture-in-picture reactions; occasional waveform overlay.
- TECH: Minor latency moments, echo cancellation, and a brief reconnect beat.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Town Hall Qa
prompts.text:
FORMAT (enforce):
- SETTING: Civic auditorium; neutral signage; hand-held audience mic; respectful crowd.
- MODERATOR: "" — ""
- SPEAKER: "" — "" — answers with inclusive, neutral language.
- Q&A: 2 audience questions; concise, respectful answers.
- SHOTS: Wide -> medium -> close-up; quick cutaways to nodding listeners.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Press Briefing
prompts.text:
FORMAT (enforce):
- SETTING: Press room lectern; backdrop; note cards; flashes; no logos.
- SPOKESPERSON: "" — ""
- KEY STATEMENT: One clear paragraph with 2 supporting points.
- Q&A: "" — "" — asks 2 concise questions; answers stay measured and factual.
- STAGE DIRECTIONS: [PAUSE], [GLANCE TO NOTES], [NEXT QUESTION].
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Awards Presenter
prompts.text:

- PRESENTER B: "" — ""

- SHOTS: Wide reveal -> singles for banter -> envelope close-up -> winner walk-up hint (generic).

prompts.title: Museum Docent Tour
prompts.text:

prompts.title: Classroom Mini Lecture
prompts.text:

Surreal Travelogue
prompts.text:
VOICE: "" — dreamy, hyperbolic travel host; "" — sardonic sidekick; ping-pong narration.
FORMAT:
- COLD OPEN: A location reveal that shouldn’t exist (e.g., a city built on the back of a moving whale).
- STOPS: 3 impossible attractions; each with a one-line local legend.
- CUTAWAYS: Ultra-brief sensory flashes in parentheses.
- BUTTON: Souvenir gag that breaks the laws of physics.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Noir Detective Monologue
prompts.text:
VOICE: Hard-boiled narrator; second-person addresses to a rainy city.
FORMAT:
- OPEN: Desk lamp halo; cigarette plume described non-glamorously.
- CASE: 3 clue beats; one red herring; one gut-punch metaphor.
- MEET: "" walks in; "" follows—shadow on shadow.
- BUTTON: Last-line sting; neon flicker.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Retro Infomercial
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: 1980s-style infomercial for a wildly unnecessary household gadget.
FORMAT:
- HOSTS: Over-caffeinated duo doing contrived demos.
- PROBLEM MONTAGE: 4 black-and-white “before” vignettes.
- MIRACLE FIX: Gadget solves them with campy transitions.
- FINE PRINT: One long, comedic disclaimer line.
- CTA: Euphoric but non-commercial phrasing (no pricing).
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Space Mission Control
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: Tense but successful mission control sequence; launch to critical event.
FORMAT (enforce):
- ROLES: Guidance, CAPCOM, Flight Director; crisp callouts.
- CHECKS: Short go/no-go roll; cross-checks; telemetry spikes noted.
- CUTS: Split screens; gloved hands; generic badges (no brands/gov logos).
- BUTTON: Cheer that stays professional.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Food Ad
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: Stylish product spot featuring "".
FORMAT:
- HERO SHOTS: Slow motion pour/sizzle/tear; macro textures; abstract backdrops.
- TASTE VO: "" delivers 2 vivid flavor lines; "" counters with 2 complementary lines.
- DISCLAIMER: No endorsements; generic language only.
- BUTTON: A playful non-slogan tag.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Taste Test
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: Split-screen blind taste test between two generic brands.
FORMAT:
1) [INTRO] Host frames it as friendly and non-definitive.
2) [A FIRST SIP] "" : 2–3 precise sensory notes.
3) [B FIRST SIP] "" : 2–3 complementary/contrasting notes.
4) [BRAND PERSONA BEAT] silent/minimal nods; outfit colors & subtle logo-styled details emphasized.
5) [DECISION] friendly wrap-up with subjective, non-definitive preference.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }
Use short, cinematic lines; no endorsements/pricing.

prompts.title: Mall Cop Chase
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: Overdramatic mall security chase through a food court.
FORMAT:
  - COLD OPEN: Security cam text overlay + dramatic slow‑mo fry spill.
  - DIALOGUE: "" (rookie mall cop) vs "" (alleged pretzel bandit). Rapid exchanges, whistle blasts, absurd PA announcements.
  - GAGS: 3 escalating sight gags (e.g., mobility scooter drift, pretzel‑tongs nunchucks, inflatable mascot tackle).
  - BUTTON: Freeze‑frame citation written like a movie poster tagline.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Awkward First Date Speedrun
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: A first date performed like a video‑game speedrun.
FORMAT:
  - HUD: Minimal on‑screen timers/checkpoints described in brackets.
  - DIALOGUE: Staccato, polite chaos; glitch‑skip small talk; any % PB energy.
  - SPLITS: 4 micro‑sections (Meet, Order, Vulnerable Overshare, Goodbye) with comedic time saves.
  - FAILSTATE: 1 hilarious soft‑reset (spilled drink, wrong name, etc.).
  - COMMENTARY: A deadpan announcer calls out ‘gold splits.’
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Time Travel Customer Support
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: A customer support line that takes calls from different centuries.
FORMAT:
  - CAST: "" (support rep) + "" (time‑displaced caller of the minute).
  - QUEUE: 4 ultra‑short calls (medieval scribe, 1920s inventor, far‑future teen, Paleolithic hunter).
  - ISSUE CARDS: Each call has a one‑line ‘ticket title’ and a quirky resolution.
  - HOLD MUSIC: Describe it humorously once.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Heist Planning Groupchat
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: A chaotic group chat planning an absurdly low‑stakes heist (e.g., rescuing a beloved office plant).
FORMAT:
  - UI: Messages labeled with usernames; occasional sticker/gif descriptions in brackets.
  - THREADS: 3 sub‑threads (blueprints, disguises, alibi).
  - TWIST: A helpful janitor quietly does the heist mid-chat.
  - BUTTON: A triumphant ‘mission accomplished’ typo.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Cooking Show Chaos Mode
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: A cooking show where every step goes off the rails but still works out.
FORMAT:
  - HOST: "" tries to keep it together; "" is the chaotic assistant.
  - RECIPE: 5 micro-steps; one accidental ingredient that becomes the signature.
  - GAGS: 3 sight gags with utensils/appliances.
  - BUTTON: Perfect-looking dish with one insane garnish.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Office Printer Exorcism
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: An office exorcism for a haunted printer.
FORMAT:
  - CAST: "" (IT ‘priest’) + "" (panicked project manager) + one timid intern.
  - RITUAL: 4 escalating steps (turn it off/on, sprinkle toner, chant driver versions, slap the tray).
  - MANIFESTATION: The printer spits out an ominous but helpful flowchart.
  - BUTTON: The ghost now handles weekly reports.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Pet Translator Infomercial
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: Late‑night infomercial for a gadget that translates pet thoughts.
FORMAT:
  - HOSTS: Duo banter, rapid cuts, mock testimonials (dog, cat, turtle).
  - FEATURES: 5 ridiculous bullet points; one honest limitation.
  - DISCLAIMER: Comically long micro‑print line.
  - CALL TO ACTION: Euphoric but non‑commercial phrasing (no pricing).
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Medieval Open Mic
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: Open mic night at a medieval tavern.
FORMAT:
  - HOST: Bell‑ringing MC introduces acts.
  - LINEUP: 4 micro‑acts (bard one‑liner, herbalist slam poem, squire prop comedy, monk beatbox).
  - CROWD: Peasants heckle in adorable archaic burns.
  - FINAL: Dragon shows up as supportive stagehand.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Haunted House Listing
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: Real‑estate listing for a charmingly haunted house.
FORMAT:
  - HEADER: Listing title + square footage + century built.
  - FEATURES: 6 bullets mixing cozy details with ghostly perks.
  - DISCLOSURES: 3 playful ‘known phenomena’.
  - TAGLINE: A punny closer an agent would love.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: Tiny Superhero Job Interview
prompts.text:
SCENARIO: A job interview where the candidate is a thumb‑sized superhero.
FORMAT:
  - PANEL: Interviewer ("") vs micro‑hero ("").
  - TASKS: 3 absurd practical tests (lift a stapler, navigate coffee foam, rescue a crumb).
  - ACCOMMODATIONS: Creative workplace adjustments.
  - OFFER: A sincere, funny closing line.
RUNTIME: "" . { "" }

prompts.title: McDonald's Drive-Thru
prompts.text: Create a realistic 10 second scene at a mcdonalds drive-thru where the camera is looking at the front passenger side of the car from a short distance. They have a friendly back and forth about something wrong with the order. Make sure to keep the physics proper with the employee inside the building with the window open and the customer inside the driver seat of the car with his window rolled down. The amount rolled down can be random, but must be down enough to pay and get the food, unless the conversation has something to do with a rolled up window needed. The car should match the style of the character. Keep both characters how they were in real life.
